Name: False door of Inyt
Description: False door of Inyt, a priestess of Hathor. She is shown sitting in front of an offering table in the centre part. Underneath the table, a lintel is resting on two doorposts. The round beam between the posts symbolises a rolled-up mat. The outer doorposts are bordered at the top of the false door by a further lintel supporting cornice and torus mouldings. The inscriptions contain the offering formula, a prayer to the gods for mercy, seeking their favour by the bearing of offerings.
